greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers which maps between the partitions as encoded in A227739 (binary based system, zero-based) to A112798 (prime-index based system, one-based).
comment: Note the indexing: the domain includes zero, but the range starts from one.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(n) = A241909(1+A075157(n)). [With A075157's original starting offset]
A227183(n) = A056239(a(n)). [Maps between the corresponding sums ...]
A227184(n) = A003963(a(n)). [... and products of parts of each partition].
For n >= 0, a(A037481(n)) = A002110(n). [Also "triangular partitions", the fixed points of Bulgarian solitaire, A226062 & A242424].
mathematica: f[n_, i_, x_] := Which[n == 0, x, EvenQ@ n, f[n/2, i + 1, x], True, f[(n - 1)/2, i, x Prime@ i]]; Table[f[BitXor[n, Floor[n/2]], 1, 1], {n, 0, 74}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 09 2017 *)
program: def b(n): return n + 1 if n<2 else prime(1 + (len(bin(n)[2:]) - bin(n)[2:].count("1"))) * b(A(n))
def a243353(n): return a005940(1 + a003188(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 07 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 05 2014
